subtitle: This pizza uses a savoury scone dough as a base, so it is fairly quick to make.

method.text: The first part of the topping: Heat 30 ml of the oil in a pan, add onions and tomatoes and fry slowly for 2-3 min until nearly soft. Add the fennel, parsley and a generous amount of seasoning and cook for 5 min. Put remaining oil and other topping ingredients to one side.
Sift the flour with the seasoning and dry mustard. Rub in the butter or margarine until the mixture looks like fine breadcrumbs. Add the egg and enough milk to make a soft, but not sticky, dough.
Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to form a large round or oblong shape, about 6mm in thickness. Brush a large baking sheet with oil, as this helps to crisp the base of the pizza.
Spread the scone dough with the <sup>1</sup>/<sub>3</sub>0 ml oil left from the topping. Cover with the fennel mixture and top with the anchovy fillets, olives and cheese.
Cook in the oven for 15 min. Then reduce heat to 180°C and cook for 10 min. If topping starts to brown too much, cover with a piece of foil. Serve in slices.
